intro: Carex pirinensis, commonly known as the Pirin sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in alpine and subalpine habitats. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered in a panicle inflorescence. Carex pirinensis is often found in rocky or grassy slopes and is adapted to the harsh conditions of high-altitude environments.
